article_title: Credit Suisse Nears Guilty Plea in $2.5 Billion Settlement
article_text:
Credit Suisse Group AG has tentatively agreed to pay almost $2.5 billion to the Justice Department and banking regulators and is expected to plead guilty to criminal charges to settle a probe into how the firm allegedly helped Americans evade taxes, according to people familiar with the matter.

The deal, which would mark an escalation in the U.S. crackdown on financial firms, could be announced early next week and would consist of a roughly $1.7 billion settlement with the Justice Department, a $100 million payment to...
